channel.title: Cody De Arkland
channel.description: Writing about developer experience, cloud infrastructure, and building with modern web technologies.

item.title: Building MCP TanStack Start: Bringing Model Context Protocol to TanStack Start
item.description: I wanted MCP servers in TanStack Start, so I built one. Here's how Claude Code helped me build mcp-tanstack-start.

item.title: Extending Sentry's JavaScript SDK to support Claude Code (using...Claude Code)
item.description: Turns out AI is pretty good at researching existing patterns, and you can extend SDKs pretty reasonably with it. I took Claude Code on a spin to see if I could integrate the Claude Code Agent SDK... and it did pretty ok!

item.title: "Write Them a Story" with NextJS and OpenAI
item.description: I wanted a way to show my kids the power of OpenAI, and build a bit with NextJS, and so "Write Them a Story" was born.

item.title: Anatomy of Awareness - DevRel Edition
item.description: Awareness and DevRel - what does it actually mean? What are awareness activities, and how can they AUTHENTICALLY feed your organizations revenue engine?

item.title: The Next Age of Developer Relations
item.description: We are square in the middle of what I consider as The Next Age of Developer Relations. How do we respond in DevRel?

item.title: What's in the Box? CodyDe.io Edition
item.description: A very different site setup than I've ran before. Svelte + GitHub as a CMS. Running in Netlify. Read more to learn why, and what's next.

item.title: Building Your Corner of the Internet
item.description: Your corner of the internet is about giving you a place for your own thoughts. The work you've done, the writing you want to do, or the notes you want to keep.

item.title: KIND and Load Balancing with MetalLB on Mac
item.description: Kind and MetalLB allow you run Kubernetes clusters within Docker and deploy Load Balancers - but theres a few tricks to get it up and running.

item.title: Anatomy of my MacOS Terminal
item.description: I spend way too much time in the MacOS terminal. Here's a few tools I've come across to make things a bit easier

item.title: Let's Talk about Imposter Syndrome
item.description: If youâ€™ve come here because you frequently find yourself feeling like a failure, know that you are NOT alone.

item.title: Infrastructure and Management as Code - Intro to vSphere API with Python
item.description: I've had a few goals for learning this year. One of them has been to crack open the scripting world of Python.

item.title: My VMWorld Session - How PG&E Is Automating Secure Environments Using NSX, vRealize Automation, and vRealize Orchestrator
item.description: A huge bucket list item for me has always been to speak at VMWorld. I'm pretty excited for the opportunity to talk about what my team has done!
